verse.roman:
duṣkaraḥ ko nu sādhūnāṁ
dustyajo vā mahātmanām
yaiḥ saṅgṛhīto bhagavān
sātvatām ṛṣabho hariḥ

synonyms: duṣkaraḥ—difficult to do; kaḥ—what; nu—indeed; sādhūnām—of the devotees; dustyajaḥ—impossible to give up; vā—either; mahā-ātmanām—of the great persons; yaiḥ—by which persons; saṅgṛhītaḥ—achieved (by devotional service); bhagavān—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; sātvatām—of the pure devotees; ṛṣabhaḥ—the leader; hariḥ—the Lord.
translation: For those who have achieved the Supreme Personality of Godhead, the master of the pure devotees, what is impossible to do, and what is impossible to give up?
